availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jones A. Crawford (Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Crawford. Father of John Crawford and Mary Crawford. Married Amanda Wilson Crawford on August 3, 1865. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Lincoln County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from February 13, 1863 to March 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 81.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 25.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Laclede County, Lebanon, p. 18.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000252359, p. 14.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 129.
